content: It looks like GitHub is starting an 8 week migration of windows-latest to Windows Server 2022 starting now. Has anyone tested it to see if there are any problems?

I started doing some testing, and it's not going well...

In terms of knowing our options and how fast this needs attention, it would help to know:

Do the special -xl runners support different versions (like windows-2022-xl or windows-2019-xl)?
Do we think GitHub will be particularly fast or slow updating windows-latest-xl? I get the impression that those tend to get updated later than the general public machines, but that's just a guess.
github alerted us that the ubuntu-latest-xl was going to be deprecated via email, they haven't said anything about windows yet
I was planning on sending the PR doing the switch tomorrow (cc @simulacrum), I can ask if they have a timeline when I respond to their email
also just saw the other thread lol
I opened #92948 just to have a place to track issues.

@Eric Huss

Our first goal is to GA Windows 2022 this quarter and then we will start the process of getting the XL pools ready.
